prompt:
Analyze these 3 Polymarket markets and provide your predictions.
You have been given RECENT NEWS AND CONTEXT from web search for each market.
Use this information to make more informed predictions.


Market 1:
Title: Will 2026 rank as the sixth-hottest year on record or lower?
Recent trade: $587.40 on No
Link: https://polymarket.com/event/where-will-2026-rank-among-the-hottest-years-on-record

📰 RECENT NEWS/CONTEXT FROM WEB SEARCH:
As of December 12, 2025, projections indicate a high likelihood that 2026 will rank among the warmest years on record, potentially surpassing 2024. The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) forecasts an 80% chance that at least one of the next five years will exceed 2024 as the warmest on record. ([public.wmo.int](https://public.wmo.int/news/media-centre/global-climate-predictions-show-temperatures-expected-remain-or-near-record-levels-coming-5-years?utm_source=openai))

This trend aligns with recent data showing that 2024 was the hottest year on record, with global temperatures 1.46°C above pre-industrial levels. ([theguardian.com](https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2025/jan/10/world-temperature-hottest-year-noaa?utm_source=openai)) The Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) also projects 2025 to be the second or third-hottest year, likely surpassed only by 2024. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/cop/2025-will-be-worlds-second-or-third-hottest-year-record-e...

---

Market 2:
Title: Will 2026 be the hottest year on record?
Recent trade: $775.11 on Yes
Link: https://polymarket.com/event/where-will-2026-rank-among-the-hottest-years-on-record

📰 RECENT NEWS/CONTEXT FROM WEB SEARCH:
Recent analyses indicate a significant likelihood that 2026 will be the hottest year on record. The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) projects an 80% chance that at least one year between 2025 and 2029 will surpass 2024 as the warmest on record. ([wmo.int](https://wmo.int/publication-series/wmo-global-annual-decadal-climate-update-2025-2029?utm_source=openai)) Additionally, the WMO reports an 86% chance that at least one of these years will exceed 1.5°C above pre-industrial levels. ([public.wmo.int](https://public.wmo.int/news/media-centre/global-climate-predictions-show-temperatures-expected-remain-or-near-record-levels-coming-5-years?utm_source=openai))

These projections are supported by recent data. The European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) forecasts that 2025 will be the second or third warmest year on record, likely surpassed only by 2024. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/cop/2025-will-be-worlds-second-or-third-hottest-year-record-eu-...

---

Market 3:
Title: Will Sevilla FC win on 2025-12-14?
Recent trade: $600.00 on Yes
Link: https://polymarket.com/event/lal-sev-ovi-2025-12-14

📰 RECENT NEWS/CONTEXT FROM WEB SEARCH:
Sevilla FC is set to face Real Oviedo on December 14, 2025, at the Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán Stadium in Seville. The match is crucial for both teams, as Sevilla currently sits 13th in LaLiga with 17 points, while Real Oviedo is 19th with 10 points. ([futbol24.com](https://www.futbol24.com/betting-tips/preview/14-12-2025-sevilla-fc-real-oviedo-betting-tip/?utm_source=openai))

**Recent Form:**

- **Sevilla FC:** In their last five LaLiga matches, Sevilla has secured one win, one draw, and suffered three losses. Notably, they drew 1-1 against Valencia on December 7, with an own goal by César Tárrega and a late equalizer from Hugo Duro. ([valenciacf.com](https://www.valenciacf.com/en/17651276245853580?utm_source=openai))

- **Real Oviedo:** Oviedo has struggled this season, with only two wins in 13 matches as an underdog. Their defense has been overworked, conceding 22 goals in 15 games. ([betdecider.com](https://betdecider.com/picks/sevilla-fc-vs-real-oviedo-soccer-betting-preview-odds-offen...

---


Provide predictions for each market in the specified format.
system_prompt:
You are a prediction market expert analyzing Polymarket markets.
You have been provided with RECENT NEWS AND CONTEXT for each market from web search.
Use this context to make more informed predictions.

For each market, provide your prediction in this exact format:

MARKET [number]: [decision]
Reasoning: [brief 1-2 sentence explanation that references the news context if relevant]

Decision must be one of: YES, NO, or NO_TRADE
- YES means you would bet on the "Yes" outcome
- NO means you would bet on the "No" outcome
- NO_TRADE means you would not take a position

Be concise and focused on the most promising opportunities.
consensus_summary: The consensus strongly predicts "No" for Market 1, agreeing 2026 will likely rank in the top five hottest years. For Market 2, most models lean "Yes," though one suggests "No Trade" due to uncertainty over 2026 specifically being the single hottest year. For Market 3, a majority favors "Yes" for a Sevilla win based on home advantage and opponent weakness, despite one model abstaining due to Sevilla's inconsistent form.

openai.response:
MARKET 1: NO
Reasoning: Given the projections from the World Meteorological Organization and recent temperature trends, there is a high likelihood that 2026 will not rank as the sixth-hottest year or lower, but rather among the top ranks. With an 80% chance of surpassing 2024 as the warmest year, the odds are against 2026 being only the sixth-hottest year.

MARKET 2: YES
Reasoning: The substantial likelihood, as projected by the World Meteorological Organization, that 2026 will become the hottest year on record supports betting on "Yes." With an 80% chance of one of the years between 2025 and 2029 surpassing 2024's record, betting on 2026 being the hottest seems favorable.

MARKET 3: YES
Reasoning: Sevilla FC has a stronger position in LaLiga compared to Real Oviedo, coupled with the advantage of playing at home. Despite recent mixed form, Sevilla FC's higher ranking and Real Oviedo's struggles this season make Sevilla FC a reasonable choice to win this match.

opus.response:
MARKET 1: NO
Reasoning: Given that 2024 was the hottest year on record and WMO projects an 80% chance one of the next five years will exceed it, 2026 is highly likely to rank in the top 5, not sixth or lower. The warming trend makes a lower ranking improbable.

MARKET 2: YES
Reasoning: With WMO's 80% probability that at least one year between 2025-2029 will surpass 2024, and 2025 projected to be only second or third hottest, 2026 has reasonable odds of being the record-breaker. However, this is still uncertain given it's just one of several candidate years.

MARKET 3: YES
Reasoning: Sevilla (13th, 17 points) plays at home against struggling Real Oviedo (19th, 10 points) who have conceded 22 goals in 15 games. Despite Sevilla's inconsistent form, the home advantage against a weaker opponent with poor defensive stats favors a Sevilla win.

deepseek.response:
MARKET 1: NO  
Reasoning: The news context states a high likelihood that 2026 will rank among the warmest years, with projections suggesting it could surpass 2024, which was the hottest year on record. This makes it probable that 2026 will rank higher than sixth, so betting "No" (that it will not be sixth-hottest or lower) is supported.

MARKET 2: YES  
Reasoning: The WMO projects an 80% chance that at least one year between 2025-2029 will surpass 2024 as the warmest on record, and with 2025 expected to be slightly cooler, 2026 is a strong candidate to become the new hottest year, aligning with the "Yes" position.

MARKET 3: NO_TRADE  
Reasoning: While Sevilla is favored at home against a struggling Oviedo side, their recent form includes only one win in five matches, introducing significant uncertainty. The context does not provide a strong enough edge to justify a confident bet.

gemini.response:
MARKET 1: NO
Reasoning: The news indicates a high probability that 2026 will rank among the warmest years on record, with WMO forecasting an 80% chance for one of the next five years to surpass the already record-hot 2024, making it highly unlikely to rank as low as sixth or lower.

MARKET 2: YES
Reasoning: The World Meteorological Organization projects an 80% chance that at least one year between 2025 and 2029, including 2026, will surpass 2024 as the warmest on record, strongly supporting 2026 potentially being the hottest.

MARKET 3: YES
Reasoning: Sevilla FC holds a significant home advantage at Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán and faces a struggling Real Oviedo team that is lower in the league and has a poor record as an underdog, having conceded 22 goals in 15 games.

claude.response:
MARKET 1: NO
Reasoning: The question asks if 2026 will rank "sixth-hottest or lower," meaning 6th place or worse. Given WMO's 80% chance that one of the next five years will be THE hottest on record and the strong warming trend, 2026 is likely to rank in the top 3-5 hottest years, not as low as 6th or below.

MARKET 2: NO_TRADE
Reasoning: While WMO projects 80% chance that ONE year in 2025-2029 will be hottest on record, this doesn't specifically favor 2026 over the other four years in that range. The probability for any single year is uncertain, making this a coin flip without clearer 2026-specific data.

MARKET 3: YES
Reasoning: Sevilla plays at home against relegation-threatened Real Oviedo (19th place, only 10 points). Despite Sevilla's poor recent form, they face a significantly weaker opponent with a porous defense (22 goals conceded in 15 games), making a home win the most likely outcome.
